summary: Ann Furnald Taylor was a staff member of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll certifications indicating that she was employed by the committee from at least February 1977 through December 1977. The payroll certifications list her name and salary, confirming her employment during that period. The documents do not specify her exact role or responsibilities within the HSCA.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Ann Furnald Taylor's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the documents do not detail her specific contributions, her presence on the payroll indicates she was part of the team involved in the investigation.
